3_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof.body:
> [iyogo887vyg87oy8](#comment_7_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof): I often do OS reinstalls and I love being able to make a new ID every time I start a new zeronet install, feels like freedom!

You can also delete your `users.json` file in the `ZeroNet/data/` folder.

> [flappyearz](#comment_65_1QEfmMwKVxgR4rkREbdJYjgUmF3Zy8pwHt): Or in fact switch on multiuser plugin and login-logout however you like.

Yes. You can rename the `disabled-Multiuser` folder to `Multiuser`. It is in the `plugins` folder within in the ZeroNet directory.

2_15TYJCh3i9W5dsoSUvchPwAuaB3BABXS6o.body:
I think you can use `signers_sign` and `signs_required` in `content.json` for that.
```
    "signers": [
        "<your public key>",
        "<friend's public key>"
    ],
   "signers_required": 1
```
See http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Docsfk5uLvuXkL4U13eYDxCm2gzi1fNQq/site_development/content_json/index.html

> [peter0](#comment_14_15TYJCh3i9W5dsoSUvchPwAuaB3BABXS6o): Also I guess it's not possible to manage comments?

Well if you want to do everything under a single identity (private key) you have to share the private key with your friend.

You have two options:
- You can edit `users.json` manually to add the user + the private key.
- Or secondly you can give the whole ZeroNet folder to your friend. Maybe you can create a new ZeroNet instance with only your blog and share that with your friend, make sure you have the user to edit your blog added as well.
